data.title: Stephen Barlow
data.meta_description: Stephen William Barlow  is an English conductor, principally of opera.
data.text:
Career

He was appointed Artistic Director of the Buxton Festival in 2012. Barlow was a chorister at Canterbury Cathedral before studying at King"s School, Canterbury, then moving to Trinity College, Cambridge, where he was an Organ Scholar. He composed the opera King, the story of Thomas Becket and Henry II of England, which had its World Premiere in Canterbury Cathedral in April 2006.
